comments:
I am using Eclipse SDK 3.1. I ran the automated tests as jUnit plug-in test. 
It says "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application 
service" while launching headless Eclipse. It hangs after that.

I have listed my stacktrace here.

Can you please look at this problem ?

eclipse-test:
     [echo] Launching headless Eclipse to test 
com.hp.cdt.remote.tests.AllRemoteTests
     [java] !SESSION 2005-08-25 16:26:44.914 ----------------------------------
-------------
     [java] eclipse.buildId=unknown
     [java] java.version=1.4.2_07
     [java] java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
     [java] BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
     [java] Framework arguments:  -application 
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.coretestapplication -testPluginName 
com.hp.cdt.remote.tests -className com.hp.cdt.remote.tests.AllRemoteTests -
port 8090 -noupdate
     [java] Command-line arguments:  -application 
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.coretestapplication -data 
build_area/temp.folder/eclipse_home/test-runtime-workspace -consoleLog -
testPluginName com.hp.cdt.remote.tests -className 
com.hp.cdt.remote.tests.AllRemoteTests -port 8090 -noupdate -os win32 -ws 
win32 -arch x86
     [java] !ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-08-25 16:26:45.446
     [java] !MESSAGE Application error
     [java] !STACK 1
     [java] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application 
service.
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:367)
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:163)
     [java] at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
     [java] at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
     [java] at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
     [java] at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
     [java] at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

I have also attached my config.ini file with this. 

I heard that we need to uncomment the following line in the config.ini file to 
solve this problem. 

osgi.bundles=org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start, 
org.eclipse.update.configurator@3:start

But in Eclipse 3.1, the config.ini contains this line by default.(in 3.0.1 
this line is commented)

Any idea about this problem ?

Created an attachment (id=26631)
config.ini file

My config.ini file
I'm sorry for the late reply, but I hope that by now you probably found the problem which was likely in the set of plug-ins you were running.
